text:
THE PRINCE ALBERT TIMES
AND SASKATCHEWAN REVIEW
PUBLISHED BY
J. D. MAVEETY
PRINCE ALBERT N.W.T.
FRIDAY, APRIL 5, 1889.

INTERESTING TO LADIES.
Our lady readers can hardly fail to have their attention called this week to the latest combination called the "New Home Sewing Machine." As we understand it, a machine of this kind can be used by anyone of any age or sex, and requires no special skill to operate. It should be simple in its operation, and should run easily; in short, do not require much strength or effort. The sewing machine is designed to be light, handy, and portable, and as such can be used consistently with excellent results throughout the year. The "New Home" sewing machine has also been tested extensively and found to be consistent with excellent results throughout the year.

The "New Home" sewing machine is also recommended to purchasers on account of its durability, convenience, and reasonable price. Over half a million have been sold in the United States alone, and the demand continues universal satisfaction. This unexcelled sewing machine is now being manufactured by the New Home Sewing Machine Co., Orangeville, Ontario.

THOS. O. DAVIS.

NOTICE
Sealed tenders—Tender for the following lots of land will be received at the office up to noon of Thursday, the 6th of April, 1889, which consists of the Lots 1 and 2 of Section 3, Township 11 North, Range 1 East, and Lots 7 and 8 of Section 4, Township 11 North, Range 1 West, all in the Town of Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

MONTREAL, P.Q.

RED DEER HILL.
A.D. Boylan is visiting here for a short time.
The roads are very rough, but will soon improve now that they are dry.
John Gibbons recently lost a valuable colt also a valuable colt of Robt. Gilks died lately.
The snow has nearly all disappeared and some weather farmers will consider seeding in a few days.
Robt. English is hard at work at his place on the three quarter section.
Wild geese were seen on the 23rd of March and ducks on the 25th. Prairie chickens are not as numerous as in former years.
The school trustees have secured the services, as teacher for the summer term, Mr. Cherry, of Island Lake, at a salary of $100 per month.
Cattle, horses and all kinds of stock that were grazed out winter and spring have returned to the neighborhood to be seen amongst them. McKay's sheep and all appear in good condition.
As a result of the recent meetings between the members held every Friday evening at And. Spencer's, who has kindly donated a building for purposes, there has been a great demand for the members nearly forty members.

THE NEW HOME SEWING MACHINE.
This is a machine of the latest design, made entirely of cast iron, and is constructed to be light, handy, durable, and as cheap as it can be made consistent with excellent results throughout the year. The "New Home" sewing machine is also recommended to purchasers on account of its durability, convenience, and reasonable price. Over half a million have been sold in the United States alone, and the demand continues universal satisfaction. This unexcelled sewing machine is now being manufactured by the New Home Sewing Machine Co., Orangeville, Ontario.

THOS. O. DAVIS.

Mahaffey & Clinkskill,

Battleford, Sask
TOWN COUNCIL

There is a great interest in the town council meeting, which was held last evening at the town hall. Mr. Smith, the mayor, presided. Several resolutions were passed, including one calling for a town meeting to be held next week.

The following resolutions were approved:

1. That the town council request the Board of Health to investigate the condition of the town's water supply.
2. That the town council request the Board of Education to provide additional funding for the town's schools.

COMMISSIONERS

Commissioners were sworn in by Judge Smith. They are responsible for overseeing the town's finances.

CLARK'S CROSSING

Clark's Crossing has been approved for the construction of a new bridge over the river. The bridge will be completed by the end of the year.

NEW HOME SEWING MACHINE

The new home sewing machine is now available for purchase. It is advertised as being the only sewing machine that gives perfect satisfaction.

THE LIGHT RUNNING

The light running is now available for purchase. It is advertised as being the only sewing machine that gives perfect satisfaction.

SHERIFF'S SALE OF LANDS

A sheriff's sale of lands is scheduled for next week. All interested parties are encouraged to attend.

APRIL FOOL

April Fool's Day is celebrated with a variety of pranks and jokes throughout the town.
